DataElement.preferredName: Uterine Corpus Leiomyosarcoma Malignant Neoplasm FIGO Stage I Diagnosis Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease of a FIGO stage defining an aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the uterine corpus.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Uterine Corpus Leiomyosarcoma Malignant Neoplasm FIGO Stage I Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease of a FIGO stage defining an aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the uterine corpus.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the uterine corpus.  It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the uterine corpus.  It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to invasive cancer that is confined to the cervix; for endometrial cancer, it refers to cancer confined to the corpus uteri with no or less than one-half myometrial invasion (IA) or invasion of one-half or more of the myometrium (IB).:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: A FIGO stage term that applies to gynecologic cancers.  For cervical cancer, it refers to invasive cancer that is confined to the cervix; for endometrial cancer, it refers to cancer confined to the corpus uteri with no or less than one-half myometrial invasion (IA) or invasion of one-half or more of the myometrium (IB).

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
